title: Essential Oils - 1st Pregnancy | Forums | What to Expect
author: D Deltacokm
description: I just read someone else's thread that essential oils can't be used in pregnancy... is this true?? I literally just put a drop of lavender in my hand and smelt it and patted my face before getting in bed. And that's something I've been doing the whole time. Should I be concerned?! I'm almost 6 weeks.

Lavender is just fine, I've been using that and I'm in week 36. I agree with the above IF you make sure it is ready for your skin. Some oils are concentrated and need to be mixed with coconut oil before you put it on your skin. I didn't use it on my skin, but I used bottles of peppermint and lemongrass oils during my pregnancy to smell when I would get nauseated. smelling essential oils is my fav thing during pregnancy. especially because burning candles is so toxic and so are air fresheners and fragrances. there's many things that are a big 'NO' in pregnancy like herbs, supplements, teas, essential oils. Since there's not many studies on how they effect pregnancy, they are all ruled unsafe. My advice is u don't have to follow that and stay away from everything. But look up the known harmful ones. And use anything in moderation, don't overdo the essential oils or tea.
